title: Maximizing Learning Outcomes in Social Studies through Digital Educational Material Design

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level subject-matter expertise and problem-solving abilities
context.additional_context: Research on designing digital materials and assessment methods reflecting diverse learning styles in real-time online environments.

learning_goals: Learners can apply cognitive scaffolding strategies (contextual trigger questions, visualization tools, multimedia elements) with over 80% accuracy when designing digital educational materials
Learners achieve a 25% or greater improvement in social domain knowledge acquisition through pre- and post-assessments
Learners rate the usability (convenience, usefulness) of digital materials at 4 points or higher on a 5-point scale

resources: Digital content authoring tools (Canva, H5P, etc.)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
